name: Avoid Procedures with High Fan-Out  (RPG400)
description: This rule searches all the procedures with High Fan-Out.
output:
This report lists RPG400 Procedure with High Fan-Out.
It provides the following information:
RPG400 Procedure full name
rationale: The higher the number of referenced procedures, the more difficult the maintenance and evolution as all updates in referenced Programs will have to be tested and taken into account.
remediation: Try to reduce the number of referenced procedures.

qualityStandards.name: Callable and Method Control Element Number of Outward Calls
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid overly complex outward dependencies

Consequence
Software that does not follow the principles of modularity causes excessive propagation of modification impacts

Measure Element
Number of instances where a named callable control element or method control element has a Fan-Out value that is too large, that is, its number of references to other objects within the application exceeds a threshold value (the application determines the scope of the search for the referenced objects). Default threshold value for the number of references to other objects within the application is 5
